oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Anthony Wayne
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Portrait of Anthony Wayne (1745-1796) shows him in military uniform posed next to a horse.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Generals
Wayne, Anthony, 1745-1796l United States -- History -- Revolution, 1775-1783 -- Campaigns.;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Wayne was a general in the Continental Army during the American Revolution. He was given the unfortunate nickname "Mad Anthony" because of his temper, not his state of sanity. Wayne commanded patriot forces at the Battles of Brandywine, Germantown, and Monmouth.
